intro: Anil congesta, commonly known as the clustered anil, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft texture. Anil congesta is often grown for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive floral display.
